The 'Chairman of the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System' is the
head of the central banking system of the United States. Known colloquially as
"Chairman of the Fed", "Fed Chairman" or "Fed Chief". The Chairman is the
"active executive officer" (see ) of the Board of Governors of the Federal
Reserve System.
